intro: Elatostema baruringense, commonly known as the Baruring grassy bladder, is a small herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, commonly known as the nettle family, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or white and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Elatostema baruringense is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
